summary: A well-researched and practical guide to microsimulation with strong citations and clear policy applications, though could benefit from more international comparisons.
strengths: Extensive citations to primary sources and academic literature
Clear connection between technical concepts and policy outcomes
Practical examples using real policy reforms and their impacts
weaknesses: Could include more comparative analysis with other countries' approaches
Some technical sections may lose general policy audience

summary: Excellent treatment of the technical architecture and open-source philosophy, with authentic details about real implementation challenges.
strengths: Detailed explanations of OpenFisca framework and vectorized computation
Genuine engagement with AI/LLM integration and its limitations (67% accuracy)
Open source philosophy is well-articulated and practiced
weaknesses: Could include more code examples and architecture diagrams
AI chapter could go deeper on prompt engineering specifics

summary: An accessible introduction to an important but obscure field, though the narrative sometimes gets lost in technical details.
strengths: Strong opening hook with Guy Orcutt's story
weaknesses: Some chapters dense with policy terminology
Could use more human stories and case studies
Transitions between historical and technical sections feel abrupt

summary: A solid intellectual history connecting microsimulation pioneers to modern applications, with appropriate methodological caveats.
strengths: Proper credit to Orcutt, Harding, and other foundational figures
Good treatment of the aggregation problem and its implications
weaknesses: Could engage more with recent microsimulation literature
Missing discussion of calibration and validation methodologies
Poverty measurement section could reference Sen, Foster more

summary: Thoughtful exploration of AI-assisted policy analysis as a potential alignment testbed, with appropriate epistemic humility about current limitations.
strengths: Honest about GPT-4's 67% accuracy on tax questions (SARA benchmark)
Good framing of deterministic backends + AI frontends as safety pattern
Connects microsimulation to value alignment questions
weaknesses: Could explore failure modes and adversarial robustness more
Missing discussion of how values get encoded in policy parameters
